description.narrative: The project aims to increase environmental education in the country and Involvement of CSOs in environmental monitoring as well as to improve environmental governance at local level,

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1 The number of established / supported environmental monitoring clubs at “green schools”. 1.2 The number of environmental monitoring trainings conducted as part of the project. 2.1 The number of CSOs involved in trainings on the green schools topics. 2.2 The number of green schools offering training according to the green schools programme. 2.3 The number of conducted trainings and the number of trained teachers on the green schools topics. 2.4 The number of designed/updated educational programmes on the green schools topics. 3.1 The number of partnership agreements between “green schools” and local government and self-government authorized to perform environmental monitoring in data collection and management, including the Hydromet. 3.2 The number of air quality monitoring reports prepared and submitted by “green schools” as part of the project. 3.3 The number of training sessions on environmental monitoring topics and the number of trained specialists. 3.4 The number of the visitors of resource centres for the duration of the project. 4.1 The number of activities for the dissemination of results conducted by CSOs as part of the project. 4.2 The number of consultations organized by the Aarhus centres a year. 4.3 The number of public environmental coordinating council meetings conducted for the project duration. 4.4 The number of CSO initiatives successfully implemented as part of the project. 4.5 The number of stakeholders involved in professional development activities as part of the project.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Lack of “environmental monitoring” clubs in 2016. 1.2 Zero environmental monitoring activities with public participation conducted as part of the project. 2.1 CSOs are not involved in the training sessions on the “green schools” topics. 2.2 140 schools are registered as the participants of the “Green Schools” Programme. 2.3 Zero trainings have been conducted and zero teachers have been trained on the “green schools” topics. 2.4 Educational programmes for the green schools are outdated and require updating. 3.1 The cooperation between the “green schools” and local government and self-government authorized to perform environmental monitoring in data collection and management is non-existent. 3.2 “Green schools” are not involved in environmental monitoring; 3.3 Zero training sessions on environmental monitoring topics have been organized as part of the project 3.4 There are no “green school” resource centres. 4.1 CSOs have organized zero awareness-raising activities as part of the project. 4.2 The Aarhus centres provide approximately 180 consultations a year. 4.3 The public environmental coordinating council conducts four meetings a year. 4.4 Zero initiatives have been successfully implemented as part of the project. 4.5 Zero stakeholders participate in capacity building activities as part of the project.

1.1 Development and publication of a guide on civic engagement in environmental monitoring. 1.2 Selection of CSOs and trainings on environmental monitoring for the volunteers - members of environmental clubs. 1.3 Organization of environmental monitoring clubs. 1.4 Opinion polls on environmental issues. 2.1 Basic training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools”. 2.2 Publication of guides and other materials for “green schools“. 2.3 Monitoring of “green schools”. 2.4 Expanding the Green Schools project to kindergartens and institutions for children with disabilities. 2.5 Updating the website dedicated to “green schools”. 2.6 Environmental camp sessions for the teachers and students of “green schools”. 3.1 Establishing of resource centres for “green schools”. 3.2 The purchase of equipment for the monitoring of air quality for “green schools”. 3.3 A training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools. 4.1 Further development of the network of Aarhus centres. 4.2 Grants for CSOs. 4.3 International cooperation and training. 4.4 Meetings of the Public Environmental Coordinating Council. 4.5 Support of the CSOs network in Belarus and their cooperation with government agencies. 4.6 Public relations, ensuring the dissemination of project results and project visibility.

1. 1310 specialists were trained on implementation of Aarhus Convention and ecological monitoring on the basis of the training programs developed by Yanka Kuala Grodno State University at 28 workshops and roundtables and 21- webinars starting from October 2019 till 31 October 2020. 2.975 pedagogues from the educational institutions from 6 regions of Belarus and Minsk city were trained under the program of professional development on running of green schools under all 6 directions of the program through 28 trainings, per 4 trainings in each of 6 regions and in Minsk. 3. 18 partnership agreements were concluded between 18 project pilots performing measurement of parameters of environment and Hydromet. The agreement stipulates production and usage of information on parameters of environment. 3.1 18 pilots/ “green schools” are putting data on environmental parameters, received with the help of the equipment for environmental monitoring delivered within the project, into the database. Since December 2019 till 30 November 2020, 30875 measurements were put into the database. 4. 31 representatives of CSOs, governmental bodies, Aarhus centres of Belarus took part in the meeting of PECC under auspices of MNREP on 30 October 2020 in Minsk. Participants discussed normative documents in the field of environmental protection that are in the process of development, and issues related to implementation of Aarhus Convention. 4.1. 52 meetings of 6 regional and Minsk city PECCs are organized with the support of the project. 4.2 About 1138 people discussed issues on engagement of public into decision-making on environmental issues, access to ecological information, crucial environmental issues of the regions, implementation of Aarhus Convention and other relevant issues at the meetings of PECCs. List of participants included environmentalists, representatives of CSOs, mass media, students, volunteers, etc. Experienced local experts to present information on the stated issues were invited to the PECCs meeting with the project support. 4.3 4 representatives of the governmental bodies increased their professional competence on involvement of CSOs in environmental decision-making, organization of access to environmental information, etc. through participation in the study visits abroad to participate in the meetings organized within Aarhus Convention

1.1 Development and publication of a guide on civic engagement in environmental monitoring. 1.2 Selection of CSOs and trainings on environmental monitoring for the volunteers - members of environmental clubs. 1.3 Organization of environmental monitoring clubs. 1.4 Opinion polls on environmental issues. 2.1 Basic training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools”. 2.2 Publication of guides and other materials for “green schools“. 2.3 Monitoring of “green schools”. 2.4 Expanding the Green Schools project to kindergartens and institutions for children with disabilities. 2.5 Updating the website dedicated to “green schools”. 2.6 Environmental camp sessions for the teachers and students of “green schools”. 3.1 Establishing of resource centres for “green schools”. 3.2 The purchase of equipment for the monitoring of air quality for “green schools”. 3.3 A training on environmental monitoring for the teachers of “green schools. 4.1 Further development of the network of Aarhus centres. 4.2 Grants for CSOs. 4.3 International cooperation and training. 4.4 Meetings of the Public Environmental Coordinating Council. 4.5 Support of the CSOs network in Belarus and their cooperation with government agencies. 4.6 Public relations, ensuring the dissemination of project results and project visibility.

1. Function of 7 environmental monitoring clubs, per one in each region was ensured allowing join efforts of civic society and educational institutions in addressing environmental issues and participation in ecological monitoring. 14 meetings of the environmental monitoring clubs were held. Support to the work of Public Environmental Coordination Council in 6 regions and in Minsk city was provided. Conditions for participation of civic society organizations and other diverse stakeholders in environmental decision-making were established. 2. 6 model regional kindergartens, per one in each region of Belarus, functioned as resource centres on green schools and provided consultations and support to the preschool educational intuitions of the region on implementation of green schools program. Functioning of National Rehabilitation Centre for Children with Disabilities in Minsk as pilot resource center for green schools for this type of institutions was ensured. Functioning of the republican pilot resource centers of green schools at Zubryonok and Nadezhda childrens health-improving centres, and pilot resource center for rural green schools at the Centre for Folk Arts and Crafts in Kopys was ensured. green schools network was expanded. 47 pedagogues from all the regions of Belarus improved their knowledge on green schools program on the basis of the professional development training program. 3. Function of the National Centre for Ecology and Local Studies as National Resource Centre on green schools was ensured. Green schools course was widely promoted throughout the country with the assistance of 6 regional auxiliary resource centres on green schools . Practical environmental monitoring activities were performed by all 18 pilot sites of the project, including 7 green schools , on the basis of which environmental monitoring clubs function, and 11 resource centres on green schools , on permanent basis, including measurement of parameters of environment and monitoring of atmospheric air. Environmental monitoring data was transferred to the information system of Belgidromet through the electronic platform eco-school.by. 4. Further support to implementation of Aarhus Convention and network of Aarhus centres, including Republican Aarhus Centre, Grodno regional Aarhus Center and Aarhus Centre of the Belarusian Republican Union of Lawyers, was ensured. Capacity of CSOs was increased through implementation of 9 ecological initiatives. 8 ecological initiatives, out of 9, delivered the planned results and ensure ecological, economic and social development at local level. Change of behavior of people towards more ecologically friendly and promotion of green schools network and ecological education was ensured through implementation of information and awareness raising campaign for different target groups.
